info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 10:06AM EDT until April 4 at 1:36AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County.
For the Huron River...including Milan...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Huron River near Milan.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding occurs in lying areas along the river from Milan to Franklin Flats.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around midday, cresting around 18.2 feet this afternoon. The river will fall back below flood stage this evening. Additional river rises are expected Saturday into Sunday which could result in the river stage exceeding minor flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
